meanings.definition: The quality of being sticky or adhesive.
meanings.sent1: The gluiness of the tape made it perfect for sticking papers together.
meanings.sent2: I had to wash my hands multiple times to remove the gluiness of the glue.
meanings.sent3: The gluiness of the honey made it challenging to separate the spoon from the jar.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a gluiness that seemed to linger in the air long after she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The gluiness of the situation was palpable, causing tension in the room.

meanings.definition: The state of being covered in glue.
meanings.sent1: After the craft project, his hands were a mess due to the gluiness from the glue.
meanings.sent2: The child's shirt showed signs of gluiness from the spilled glue.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly complained about the gluiness on her fingers, blaming the art project.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the gluiness of creativity as the students worked on their projects.
meanings.sent5: The gluiness of the glue spread to everything it touched, creating a sticky situation.

meanings.definition: The ability to stick things together.
meanings.sent1: The strong gluiness of the adhesive kept the pieces firmly in place.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter praised the gluiness of the wood glue for its bonding strength.
meanings.sent3: The gluiness of the tape was put to the test as it held the torn paper together.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship had a special gluiness that kept them close despite the distance.
meanings.sent5: The gluiness of teamwork was evident as they collaborated seamlessly on the project.
